Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Understand the Goal The objective is to merge two event logs Log A and Log B into a single unified enriched log The key challenges are differing timestamps differing event names and different attributes

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Analyze Log A Format timestamp event type order id Events 20231010T100000Z Order Received Order1234 20231010T100130Z Order Validated Order1234 20231010T100200Z Payment Processed Order1234 20231010T100500Z Item Shipped Order1234 20231010T102000Z Item Delivered Order1234 Analyze Log B Format timestamp event name order id user id resource id notes Events 20231010T095958Z OrderReceived Order1234 u45 r10 Event captured at warehouse system

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Matching Strategy Criterion Same orderid Criterion Time tolerance prompt suggests less than 2 seconds interpret slightly offset liberally rely on event name similarity Tolerance Policy sliding window closest match within reasonable timeframe 10 seconds combined with semantic matching of event names

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Matching Events Pair 1 Order Received Log A 100000Z Order Received Log B 095958Z OrderReceived Names nearly identical Time difference 2 seconds Decision Merge Pair 2 Order Validated Log A 100130Z Log B 100129Z OrderValidation Names similar Time difference 1 second Decision Merge Pair 3 Payment Processed Log A 100200Z Payment Processed Log B 100205Z PaymentCheck Time difference 5 seconds Names semantically linked Decision Merge Event 4 Quality Check Log B 100300Z No corresponding in Log A Decision Keep Separate Pair 5 Item Shipped Log A 100500Z Log B 100502Z Shipping Time difference 2 seconds Names semantically equivalent Decision Merge Event 6 Item Delivered Log A 102000Z No corresponding in Log B Decision Keep Separate

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Constructing the Output define schema merged timestamp Using Log A as primary event name unified order id user id from Log B resource id from Log B notes from Log B source indicate merged or single

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Refining the Output Table Merged Event Order Received Timestamp A 100000Z B 095958Z Unified Name Order Received Attributes user id u45 resource id r10 notes Event captured at warehouse system Merged Event Order Validated Timestamp A 100130Z B 100129Z Unified Name Order Validated Attributes u12 r10 Cross check inventory Merged Event Payment Processed Timestamp A 100200Z B 100205Z Unified Name Payment Processed Attributes u12 r99 Payment gateway delay Unique Event Quality Check Timestamp 100300Z Attributes u45 r11 Random inspection Source System B Merged Event Item Shipped Timestamp A 100500Z B 100502Z Unified Name Item Shipped Attributes u45 r10 Package handed to courier Unique Event Item Delivered Timestamp 102000Z Source System A

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Drafting the Reasoning Documentation Timestamp Priority Used Log A as primary Matching Logic Order ID anchor time window approx 10s semantic name matching Specific handling Payment Processed PaymentCheck 5 second gap accepted semantic link strong Log B delay note Quality Check no match enrichment unique Item Delivered no match System B stops at shipping

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Self Correction during drafting Tolerance prompt explicitly less than 2 seconds Order Received 2s diff Acceptable Order Validated 1s diff Acceptable Payment 5s diff Borderline justify semantic matching context notes Shipping 2s diff Acceptable Final Polish Structure response clearly Log first then Reasoning
